div.p: Greetings. Yesterday at nightfall, I received your letters, most esteemed father, from which I learned that all of mine have been delivered to you. However, I do not request either description back from you. Yesterday, I handed letters to a certain student for you. I also heard the rumor about borrowing money, perhaps not without foundation; I will act as if dealing with another matter regarding this with the consul.
Forgive me; for I could not write more.
To the most distinguished man, Heinrich Bullinger, chief minister of the Church of Zurich, his most esteemed lord.
